results.title: Ivan the Terrible [Part 1]
results.creator_credit: Sergei Eisenstein, Central Cinema Studios and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: Ivan the Terrible part one is Eisenstein’s boldest and most successful experiment in stylisation. It draws upon the other arts - Wagnerian opera, Marinsky ballet and Japanese Kabuki theatre. Ivan’s personal life is interwoven with the themes of his drive for empire and his alliance with the merchant class against the aristocracy. This is the first part of a trilogy; the second part is dominated by cloak and dagger intrigue; the final part, which was to be in colour, was designed but not filmed. Cinematography by Edouard Tisse and Andrei Moskvin. Music by Sergei Prokofieff. Cast includes Nikolai Cherkasov, Ludmilla Tselikovskaya, Seraphina Birman, Pyotr Kadochnikov. In russian with English subtitles.

results.title: Italy: the land and the people
results.brief_description: This film depicts the agriculture, industry, and principle cities and culture of Italy, from the fertile Po Valley in the north, south along the Apennines and adjacent coastal land to the islands of Sicily and Sardinia. Emphasises new industrial growth in the sixties and participation in the European community.

results.title: Italy today
results.brief_description: Via powerful imagery, this film shows strong contrasts between the wealthy industrial cities of Italy’s north, and the time honoured customs of the poor farmers in the south during the seventies. The agriculture and the industries of each area are examined and possible solutions for the South’s problems are discussed.

results.title: Italianissimo 2: intermediate: a multimedia course for learning Italian
results.creator_credit: Denise De Rome and BBC Books
results.brief_description: The course book is divided into two levels, each of five units. Each unit contains conversations, key phrases, language patterns and a variety of exercises, including special vocabulary building sections. Each level is followed by grammar summaries, additional exercises and a “Cultura” section introducing some Italian paintings and poetry. The book accompanies the video and audio cassettes which may be borrowed as separate loan items.

results.title: Italianissimo 1: beginners: a multimedia course for learning italian
results.brief_description: The books contain most of the conversations recorded in the video episodes of the series. The “Teacher’s edition” gives detailed notes with additional material as well as lesson plans and optional exercises. The “Student’s edition” reviews material in the course with language exercises and notes on italian life and culture. The videos and audio-cassettes may be loaned as separate items. The author of the two texts is Denise De Rome.

results.title: Italian farm family
results.brief_description: A glimpse of life in Italy during the late sixties in the farming area near Mt. Vesuvius. Shows the day to day life of the Falco family: the sowing and reaping of the crops, bread baking in the home and the many tasks undertaken by various members of the family. Also shown is the community life in the area.

results.title: Italian children
results.brief_description: Depicts activities in the daily life of farm children in the province of Umbria. Portrays features of their home environment such as their house, garden and food, show children participating in the farm work, particularly in the picking and processing of olives. Illustrates the role of family festivities and musical enjoyment in the lives of Italian children, and features market activities in the Italian city of Assissi.

results.title: It need not happen
results.brief_description: A report on the statistics of road accidents and the measures that are being taken to improve the safety of the roads. The film maintains that, by exercising care in the use of the roads, the public can co-operate in making them safe.
